original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 3/ 1/4 = 12 one-fourth miles in 3 miles.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So, Lexi will have to run 12 (from 3 miles) + 1 (from 1/4 mile) = <<12+1=13>>13 complete laps.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2778.
    Returns: the total number of complete laps Lexi must run.
    """
    # L1
    total_miles_whole = 3 # three and one-fourth miles
    lap_length_as_fraction = Fraction(1, 4) # a quarter of a mile
    one_fourth_miles_in_whole = total_miles_whole / lap_length_as_fraction

    # L2
    additional_lap_from_quarter_mile = 1 # one-fourth miles in three and one-fourth miles
    total_laps = one_fourth_miles_in_whole + additional_lap_from_quarter_mile

    # FA
    answer = total_laps
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {total_miles_whole}/ {lap_length_as_fraction} = {one_fourth_miles_in_whole} one-fourth miles in {total_miles_whole} miles.

So, Lexi will have to run {one_fourth_miles_in_whole} (from 3 miles) + {additional_lap_from_quarter_mile} (from 1/4 mile) = <<{one_fourth_miles_in_whole}+{additional_lap_from_quarter_mile}={total_laps}>>{total_laps} complete laps.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There are 3/ 1/4 = 12 one-fourth miles in 3 miles.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So, Lexi will have to run 1/4 (from 3 miles) + 1 (from 1/4 mile) = <<1/4+1=5/4>>5/4 complete laps.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'lap_length_as_fraction' (value: 1/4) was used instead of 'one_fourth_miles_in_whole' (value: 12).
